ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I not only furthered my knowledge of woman artists and feminist theory, but also my art history skills as well.
Was a very entertaining class, learned a lot about how to critically learn about women artists
This class offered an excellent overview of feminist art historical critique and introduced me to many interesting artists.

I learned about various women artists throughout history, and also learned about feminist art historical theory and different ways of understanding how being a woman has interacted with and impacted being an artist for women artists at various points throughout history. I also developed my research and writing skills through writing the research paper due at the end of the term.
I loved all the art and artists we learned about and the readings were great!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this class included the discussions, the ability to study the YUAGs exhibition, and Prof. Armstrongs passion. One weakness included the lack of grade feedback.

I thought that the readings and discussions were generally very interesting, and I appreciated the freedom to choose our own research topics. I also appreciated that while the class was thematically cohesive, we were simultaneously able to examine many different kinds of art (medium, time period, geography, etc.).
I think more variation in the day to day of how the class is run would be great, and more activities like gallery visits.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Totally, one of the best classes
Yes, definitely! Really interesting course that expands your worldview.

Yes! The discussions were interesting, week to week there is not too much work other than the readings, and you have freedom to research whatever is of interest to you. Professor Armstrong also provides helpful feedback and is skilled at leading classroom discussion.
Yes, if they are interested in female artists throughout history.
